subclusters.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, ubiquinone role, and mitochondrial dysfunction as primary drivers of aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS generation and oxidative damage leading to muscle aging and sarcopenia.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS production, antioxidant defense decline, and oxidative damage in skeletal muscle aging.
Describes progressive accumulation of mitochondrial ROS-induced oxidative damage causing functional decline.
Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation from ROS and the insufficiency of antioxidant defenses.
Discusses systemic oxidative stress from free radicals and lipid peroxidation driving aging.
Details mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS/RNS accumulation, and impaired antioxidant defenses in aging and COPD.
Focuses on ROS-induced protein carbonylation and oxidative protein damage as causal in aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production and nitrones as antioxidants targeting oxidative damage.
Covers ROS/RNS production, oxidative stress imbalance, and inflammation driving aging and disease.
Focuses on ROS-induced DNA damage accumulation and decline in DNA repair efficiency with age.
Describes oxidative stress causing modification and fragmentation of elongation factor 2, impairing protein synthesis.
Focuses on glycation-induced inactivation of NADP(+)-dependent isocitrate dehydrogenase leading to oxidative imbalance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights uric acid as a major endogenous antioxidant protecting against oxidative stress and promoting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes enhanced antioxidant defenses and selective activation of antioxidant mechanisms in longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on endogenous antioxidant enzymes and dietary antioxidants modulating oxidative stress and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DAF-16/FOXO regulation of antioxidant genes enhancing oxidative stress resistance and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on extracellular superoxide dismutase (EC-SOD) scavenging ROS and protecting against cognitive decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights Nrf2 dysregulation reducing antioxidant defenses and promoting oxidative damage with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Capacity and Endogenous Scavenger Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses imbalance of ROS and antioxidants affecting synaptic plasticity and cognitive aging.
Proposes moderate ROS as signaling molecules inducing adaptive stress responses that promote longevity.
Describes hormetic mitochondrial metabolism induction by mild stressors promoting lifespan extension.
Focuses on ROS dual role in synaptic plasticity signaling pathways and age-related functional decline.
Details oxidative inhibition of autophagy enzymes Atg3 and Atg7 via thiol oxidation impairing cellular homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress in Alzheimer's Disease Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress to AD lesion formation and accelerated neurodegeneration as a specific aging pathology.
